node.title: Netflix, TikTok suspend services in Russia
node.description: "Given the circumstances on the ground, we have decided to suspend our service in Russia," a Netflix spokesperson said, joining a growing list of companies that have stopped doing business in the country.

node.title: Mainzeal directors made rational decisions for company, Supreme Court hears
node.description: Three Mainzeal directors should not be held as creditor guarantors for the failed construction company, their lawyer has told the Supreme Court.

node.title: Ukraine artwork unveiled at Beehive
node.description: A Ukrainian artwork has been brought out of Parliament's vaults, and the Ukraine flag is flying from Parliament, in a show of solidarity with the country's fight against invading forces.

node.title: The hit to your wallet from higher gas prices: $2,000 a year
node.description: Already slammed with the highest inflation in 40 years, some consumers say they'll cut back amid rising gas prices.

node.title: Pair who caused Northland lockdown won't be charged
node.description: Two Covid-infected women who put Te Tai Tokerau into a 12-day lockdown and hid from police won't be charged.

node.title: Uniqlo vows to keep its stores open in Russia
node.description: "Clothing is a necessity of life," said Fast Retailing's CEO of his decision to keep Uniqlo stores open in Russia.

node.title: McDonald's and Pepsi still open for business in Russia
node.description: Fast-food chains and multinational beverage companies face pressure to suspend operations in Russia.

node.title: NFL star Calvin Ridley suspended for allegedly betting on games
node.description: The NFL also said there was no evidence that any  coaches, staff, teammates, or other players knew about the alleged betting.

node.title: Vodafone looks to sell billion dollar mobile towers
node.description: The telecommunications giant Vodafone New Zealand is exploring the potential sale of its mobile towers.

node.title: Doctors filling in as Middlemore hit with staff shortages
node.description: Doctors are stepping in to cover some nursing duties as staff absences reach a critical point at Middlemore Hospital.

node.title: Russian restaurants in U.S. face harassment over Ukraine war
node.description: "We have nothing to do with the war," one restaurateur said. "We want the war to end. We did not invade Ukraine."

node.title: Hawke's Bay Hospital services reduced as Covid-19 outbreak grows
node.description: Hawke's Bay Hospital has had to scale back some of its services and operations, as the number of Covid patients in the hospital grows. Audio

node.title: People are donating to Ukrainians by booking their Airbnbs
node.description: People booked 61,000 nights in Ukraine on March 2 and 3.

node.title: NZ drawing on its 'international political capital' to punish Russia, expert says
node.description: An international affairs expert says New Zealand's tailored approach to further sanctions on Russia is a strategic move.

node.title: Mainzeal case before the Supreme Court today
node.description: The former directors and chief executive of the construction firm are fighting to overturn the Court of Appeal's decision to send the case back to the High Court to determine new penalties for…

node.title: Former commander of U.S. forces in Europe predicts Russia won't take Kyiv
node.description: Retired Lieutenant General Ben Hodges said he foresaw "lots more destruction and fighting" in and around Kyiv, but he predicted that Ukraine's capital "will not fall."

node.title: West hits Russian oligarchs where it hurts — their mega-yachts
node.description: Some wealthy owners are "hightailing it on the high seas" as they scramble to move their yachts beyond sanctioned territory.

node.title: Man charged with killing 18 woman says he's "very innocent "
node.description: Billy Chemirmir denies all the charges against him and told The Dallas Morning News that he is "100% sure I will not go to prison."

node.title: Man charged with killing 18 women says he's "very innocent "
node.description: Billy Chemirmir denies all the charges against him and told The Dallas Morning News that he is "100% sure I will not go to prison."

node.title: Porirua council plans to move houses for future flood planning
node.description: Some homes in Porirua may be raised, relocated or bought-out as the city grapples with its flood-prone future.

node.title: Ukrainians fleeing to Poland face long journey, frigid weather
node.description: Around one million people have arrived in Poland since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24, Polish officials said.

node.title: 'Whakapapa is where I should have been', Māori survivor tells Abuse in Care Inquiry
node.description: The Abuse in Care Royal Commission of Inquiry has heard of young Māori being torn from their families and put into a system that wrote them off from the start.

node.title: Watch Chatham Islanders episode 1: Beneath the Surface
node.description: What is life like on Aotearoa's remotest island? Chatham Islanders: Tchakat Tchatam Airani is a series about a remote community we see and hear very little from.

node.title: Stocks fall as Ukraine war keeps pushing up oil prices
node.description: Tougher U.S. sanctions against Russia are expected as the conflict in Ukraine gets bloodier and bloodier.

node.title: COVID-19 study sees "significant" impact on brain
node.description: Researchers are still trying to understand how the virus results in symptoms that impact the brain for months after an infection.

node.title: Covid-19: 28 Parliament protesters believed to have tested positive
node.description: Twenty-eight of the protesters who occupied Parliament grounds over the past month have now tested positive for Covid-19.

node.title: Peters scores second medal of Paralympics in less than 24 hours
node.description: Corey Peters has won his second medal of the Beijing Paralympics in less than 24 hours - a silver in the Super-G event.

node.title: Oil hits 13-year high as US mulls Russia crude ban
node.description: Consumers are feeling the impact of higher energy costs as fuel prices and household bills jump.

node.title: Mother, 2 sons stabbed in daylight Philadelphia attack
node.description: A neighbor told CBS Philadelphia that the children were stabbed while attempting to protect their mom.

node.title: Bed Bath & Beyond shares soar 40% on meme-stock interest
node.description: Investor Ryan Cohen, with his huge following on Reddit, pushes for sale or breakup of the retailer after revealing a 10% stake.
